titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 3/18/14 ORDERING that Plaintiffs application to proceed in forma pauperis (ECF No. 2) is dismissed without prejudice; Clerk of the Court is directed to send plaintiff a new Application to Proceed In Forma Pauperis By a Prisoner; and Plaintiff shall submit, within thirty days from the date of this order, a completed and signed application to proceed in forma pauperis on the current form provided with this order. (Dillon, M)

(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 4/2/2014 ORDERING Plaintiff shall submit, within 30 days from the date of this order, a certified copy of his prison trust account statement for the six month period immediately preceding the filing of the complaint; the Clerk of the Court is directed to send plaintiff a new Application to Proceed in Forma Pauperis by a Prisoner. (Attachments: # (1) Application to Proceed IFP)(Reader, L)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 5/6/2014 GRANTING plaintiff's 10 motion to proceed IFP; plaintiff shall pay the $350.00 filing fee in accordance with the concurrent CDCR order; claims against defendant Knipp are DISMISSED with leave to amend within 30 days, plaintiff is not obliged to amend his complaint; allegations are sufficient to state a claim against defendant Parciasepe; the Clerk shall provide plaintiff with forms for service which plaintiff may complete and return within 30 days; plaintiff shall return the Notice of Submission or Amendment with response; and plaintiff's 5 motion is DENIED. (Yin, K)

(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS be made from Prison Account of Marcelino Clemente signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 5/6/2014. CDCR is to collect an initial partial filing fee and thereafter the balance in monthly payments and forward to the Clerk until the $350.00 filing fee is paid in full. The Clerk is directed to serve this order and copy of plaintiff's IFP on the Director of CDCR. The Clerk shall also serve Financial with a copy of this order. (cc: CDCR, Financial)(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 6/26/2014 DENYING plaintiff's 18 motion to append declarations to the complaint; DIRECTING the Clerk to return the original witness declarations (ECF No. 18 at 3-5) to plaintiff; DENYING plaintiff's 17 motion for the appointment of counsel, without prejudice; and DISMISSING plaintiff's claims against defendant Knipp, without prejudice. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 3/5/2015 RECOMMENDING that defendant's 29 motion for summary judgment on defendant's retaliation claim be granted, and plaintiff's retailiation claims against defendant be dismissed without prejudice, based on plaintiff's failure to exhaust administrative remedies. Referred to Judge Morrison C. England, Jr.; Objections due within 14 days. (Yin, K)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:14-cv-00611; (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al;

Referred to Judge Morrison C. England, Jr.; Objections due within 14 days. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ADOPTING 39 FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS, in full, signed by Chief Judge Morrison C. England, Jr. on 4/15/2015. Defendant's 29 Motion for Summary Judgment on defendant's retaliation claim is GRANTED and plaintiff's retaliation claims against defendant are DISMISSED without prejudice based on plaintiff's failure to exhaust administrative remedies. This action now proceeds SOLELY on plaintiff's 39 8th Amendment claim. (Marciel, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:14-cv-00611; (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al;

This action now proceeds SOLELY on plaintiff's 39 8th Amendment claim. (Marciel, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 7/13/2015 PARTIALLY GRANTING plaintiff's 54 motion. The Mule Creek State Prison Litigation Coordinator is requested to, within 14 days, file and serve a written statement identifying the location of plaintiff's legal materials, and plaintiff's access thereto, and addressing whether plaintiff's legal materials that were in the possession of inmate Alonzo Joseph have been returned to plaintiff. The Clerk skall serve a copy of this order on the MCSP Litigation Coordinator. Plaintiff's 54 motion for appointment of counsel is DENIED. Plaintiff's 55, 56 motions for an extension of time are GRANTED, and plaintiff has 45 days to file an opposition to the motion for summary judgment. (Yin, K)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:14-cv-00611; (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al;

The Clerk skall serve a copy of this order on the MCSP Litigation Coordinator. Plaintiff's 54 motion for appointment of counsel is DENIED. Plaintiff's 55, 56 motions for an extension of time are GRANTED, and plaintiff has 45 days to file an opposition to the motion for summary judgment. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Clemente v. Parciasepe et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Kendall J. Newman on 10/22/15 ordering within 14 days from the date of this order, defendant shall provide to plaintiff a copy of pages 5,7,8,9,10,21 and 22 of Villiers' 11/13/14 deposition transcript, as well as a copy of exhibit 1 thereto (Villiers' 11/06/14 letter)Defendant's motion for summary judgment 47 is denied without prejudice to its renewal within 21 days from the date of this order. Defendant is not required to re-file the motion and supporting documents, but may reference the prior filings in the notice. Plaintiff shall file a revised opposition to the re-noticed motion within 30 days after the notice is served; plaintiff is not required to re-submit his exhibits but may ask the court to attach his previously-submitted exhibits 64 at 20-61, to his revised opposition, but is not required to include all of his arguments and any new evidence within the revised opposition. After defendant's revised reply is filed, briefing on the motion for summary judgment is closed, and no further filings in connection thereto are allowed. (Plummer, M)

Defendant is not required to re-file the motion and supporting documents, but may reference the prior filings in the notice. Plaintiff shall file a revised opposition to the re-noticed motion within 30 days after the notice is served; plaintiff is not required to re-submit his exhibits but may ask the court to attach his previously-submitted exhibits 64 at 20-61, to his revised opposition, but is not required to include all of his arguments and any new evidence within the revised opposition.
